q: In programming, a ________ is a named space for storing data that can be changed during the execution of a program.
Python uses the ________ keyword to create a function that can be called with a variable number of arguments.
Java is known for its 'Write Once, ________ Anywhere' principle.
In object-oriented programming, ________ is the ability of a class to have more than one method with the same name.
Git is a distributed version control system that was created by ________.
The CAP theorem in distributed databases states that it is impossible to achieve Consistency, Availability, and ________ simultaneously.
Big O notation is used to describe the efficiency or complexity of an ________.
Python is primarily used for front-end web development.
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
JavaScript is a server-side programming language.
Python uses braces ({}) to define blocks of code.
Git is a distributed version control system.
Object-oriented programming allows for multiple inheritance in Python.
SQL is a programming language used for creating and modifying databases.
